comment: Professor Rast was okay. I personally wouldn't take him again. His lectures were extremely long and boring and the content quizzes were hard. The papers weren't that hard except for the last paper he had us do for our final. The reading quizzes were easy. If you have a heavy schedule do not take him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Do good on the papers, and go to class and you will at least pass. Lectures were very boring. There were 3 reading quizzes where you use the book, and 4 content quizzes (very hard) which were based on what we did in class.  4 papers to write each about a different time in history, but with every paper, you have to add a certain writing component.
rating_tags: Participation matters--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Planned on dropping the class during drop week, emailed Mr. Rast and he said I have a good chance of making an A regardless of failing the first quiz and getting 75 on response paper 1. Ended up with a good grade, was NOT easy, but it was not impossible. Prof. Rast looks for specific things and if you meet the criteria, you will be just fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Prof Rast obviously cares about what he's teaching. There's 4 papers that are a pain to write, but once you figure out how to, they aren't difficult to do well on. His videos and discussions are easy but there's SO many, I listened to them all on 2x speed. More work than you'd expect, but its all interesting and Prof Rast was easy to contact
rating_tags: Participation matters--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Taken online. This class is not meant to be an easy A, there are lecture videos, multiple short discussion posts, quizzes, and papers, but it's clear he is trying to create well-rounded learners. If you work hard and study you will do well. My only critique is the lectures are a bit monotone but he tries his best to make them interesting.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Rast is a chill dude and while his lectures may be a little dry, if you show up to class and put in some effort you'll come out with a good grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Nice dude that knows a lot about history, but taking him online is stressful. Lots of discussion boards every week, along with a usual content or reading quiz every two weeks or so. Four response papers throughout the semester and theyre not too bad but the last three creep up on you and are crammed in at the end. Difficult to take online.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Professor rast is cool and provides weekly lectures however the class is extensive. On average there are 7 discussion post. Some weeks it could be 10 other weeks it could be 5. There are 6 quizzes and 4 papers throughout the semester. responds to emails quickly!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor rast gives so many discussion post every week. On average it is 7. some weeks it can be 10 other weeks 5. There are 6 quizzes throughout the semester and 4 papers you have to complete. He's cool and responds to emails and will provided multiple lectures every week, but the work load is too extensive.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Had to write up to ten discussion posts per week, on average 8. Lockdown quizzes with questions only found within required to watch 25 minute video lectures. 4 essays all required to be over 4 pages long. 3 hour class and probably requires at least 10 hours a week to have a chance to pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: One of my favorite professors. 3 test multiple choice and short response, but he lets you choose which ones you want to do. Attendance matters so much and is worth the same amount as the paper. there are just specific things he is looking for, but he lets you know what they are. Do not miss class 15% of grade extra credit just for talking in class
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Rast is knowledgeable and understanding. This class is relatively easy if you go to class, take notes, and read the textbook before tests. Info in the test comes straight from lectures which can be boring. He's not going to walk you through it all, but it's a good class if you put in the effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Amazing teacher, super helpful, you have to put in the work and not be lazy. 2 open book reading quizzes, 3 tests, 1 paper. Gives good feedback and extra credit. He gives good study guides before the tests. If you go to class and study before the test youll do good. Attendance not required but you need to go.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Rast made this class way more difficult than it had to be. There's only 6 total grades that go into the grade book. He ended up making attendance a grade at the end of the semester to attempt to bring our bad grades up. He is a tough grader and does not help AT ALL even when you email for tips and extra help! Do NOT recommend this class!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: If you want to keep your GPA DONT HAVE HIM AS A PROFESSOR!!! The study guides for the test are abysmal !And sometimes the study guide that you studied all night for doesnt even match with the test he gives you. The lectures are mind numbingly boring and the PowerPoints are so mediocre in content depth that youre better off watching crash course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Most in my class complained about him because they expect to be handed a good grade without putting in any work. Rast has honestly been a pleasure to learn from and he is extremely knowledgeable in history. You will need to go to class and take notes which is expected for a college course. He instructs the paper easily with outlining questions.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: When I tell you that prior to this class I actually enjoyed history, I mean it. This professor is one of the most difficult graders I've ever had. His tests are very scattered and he doesnt post powerpoints online. His lecture style is very slow so much so that many of my classmates and myself had trouble staying awake. DONT TAKE IF U WANT TO PASS!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Truly a good-hearted Professor, however his class is VERY lecture heavy and he does not post his lectures online, so you have to show up and actuallt take notes. You have very few assignments so make them count. He is a monotone lecturer, so unless you have a genuine liking of history, it may be hard for you to pay attention in class. He is caring.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I had a great experience with Professor Rast. His class is 90% lectures so if you don't learn that way I wouldn't take his class. He is clearly super passionate and knowledgeable about history, he also obviously cares about his students. The class is hard but not impossible, he is super accessible outside of class. Great professor in my opinion.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He seems to care a lot about the subject but is a horrible teacher. This class was hard and hes a tough grader. Only lectures, nothing is put online, and if you miss class he wont email you the notes.

Ive definitely had worse teachers/professors in my life, but this class isnt anything special. Hes very caring and, from my experience, easy to reach outside of class. Tests are hard and even harder to study for because the class notes are lacking. Its clear he cares about us and what hes teaching, but the bars a bit to high for a gen ed class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Although he was a nice person, this class messed up my gpa. I have never gotten a C in a class ever and I got my first C in a history class?! He gives powerpoint slides but wont post them online. They are just bullet points for the most part, but the tests have several short answer problems. This class was so much information for each test
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: He is a nice guy but an awful teacher. He only reads powerpoints that dont even give real information, just a bunch of people and words. He grades heavy and gives little instructions for the big project at the end.I love history and wanted to major in it and I have never not made an A in a history class and now I am probably going to make a C
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Professor Rast is a caring individual. He tries to make lectures interesting and doesn't just read off the slides. I like that he brought up different perspectives: having taken history class before I thought it would be a repeat but it wasn't. If you show up to class, take notes on what he's saying, and study before exams, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: We really only had 6 total grades. His lectures are very hard to sit through and he doesnt upload his presentations online. Hes also extremely difficult to reach outside class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I used to love history until I took this class. He just refuses to post power points online for no reason, and overloads you with some much information for few assignments. I have 6 assignments in the gradebook throughout the whole semester. He does not help you. If you want a good GPA, then DO NOT take this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take this class! As much as I'd hate to say it, this professor was awful! He grades way too hard one. Not only that, the class contains three tests meaning there is an overload of information that must be learned in accordance to the test dates. I am an all A student, but this class changed that unfortunately. In conclusion... DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This was my hardest class this semester. I would not take him again. He doesn't put in a lot of grades so if you don't do well on one thing, then it tanks your grade. His entire lectures are PowerPoints that he doesn't post online and it is heavy notetaking. If you struggle with history, I would not recommend this professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor is a nice guy and is very passionate about History. However, your only grades are 3 exams, 2 textbook quizzes, and a final project. His lectures are long and boring, plus he goes pretty quick. He DOESN'T post lectures or notes online, in class is the only way to get material besides your book. Tests are hard and hes a tough grader.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Rast seems to be a caring individual and very passionate about history. However, if you do not share this same passion and taking it just as a gen ed credit (most of us) I would steer away from this class. You are expected to know very specific things and test preparations do not help. Again, if you arent a history guru do not take this.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Rast is a decent professor, and he cares for his students seemingly. However, lectures are over an hour long of him reading off a powerpoint, while explaining it. Personally I couldn't copy the powerpoint and what he had to say about it at the same time. He refuses to post any content online, so you have to go in to get the power point.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor lectures every day and expects you to remember minute details. He refuses to give out copies of his PowerPoint and doesn't help much w test preparation. The study guides for the tests do not help to prepare as he has each class create their own. He doesn't say what specific material would be the most helpful to learn for tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy
